data.title: A Comic Recommendation: A History of the World in Six Glasses
data.meta_description: I almost died from laughing while watching this comical documentary, eating, and drinking. Mostly drinking, but yeah…
data.text:
REVIEW | HISTORY | DOCUMENTARY | COMEDY

OMG, remember “History of the World” produced by Mel Brooks…this isn’t it.

Can you imagine Mel Brooks is 97 and just accepted a lifetime achievement award from the Academy Awards? He’s one of those EGOT awardees, the rare entertainer that has won an Emmy, Grammy, Oscar, and Tony.

“What Could Possibly Go Wrong?”

Anyway, they’ve put together some other comic giants from years gone by for this documentary. Specifically, Dan Aykroyd, Jim Belushi, Jon Lovitz, Kevin Nealon, and yes, holy crap, they pulled this SOB, Norm, George Wendt from the Cheers mothballs for this adaptation of Tom Standage’s book of the same name available on Amazon.

It’s five very funny guys, with Dan leading a history lesson while bartending.
